qas.question: What did dogs clean up to help with keeping habitations of people clean?
What do Australian aborigines call a frigid night?
What did a dog's good hearing help humans with?
How could dogs have helped with sanitation issues in camps?
What is the Australian Aboriginal expression that indicates a very cold night?

context: Humans would also have derived enormous benefit from the dogs associated with their camps. For instance, dogs would have improved sanitation by <a3_0>cleaning up <a0_0>food scraps<a3_0/>.<a0_0/> Dogs may have provided warmth, as referred to in the Australian Aboriginal expression "<a1_0><a4_0>three dog night<a4_0/><a1_0/>" (an exceptionally cold night), and they would have alerted the camp to the presence of predators or strangers, using their acute hearing to provide an <a2_0>early warning.
